title: Sample, ca. 1942
medium:
Medium: cotton, synthetic and metallic yarns
Technique: plain weave
dimensions:
H x W (sample): 20 x 17.1 cm (7 7/8 x 6 3/4 in.)
H x W (card): 31.8 x 27.9 cm (12 1/2 x 11 in.)
creditline: Gift of the Estate of Dorothy (Liebes) Morin
description: Woven sample mounted to a cardboard card with notations by the designer. Very open plaid in yellow and silver. Warp is a repeating sequence of metallic silver wrapped yarns, yellow bouclé, and braided clear plastic strips. Weft has bands of yellow rickrack trim, braided clear plastic strip, yellow bouclé, braided flat silver foil, and silver metallic wrapped yarns.

tombstone.epitaph:
